markdownRemark.html:
We’ve done a major rewrite in an attempt to simplify the settup process, and clarify how centralized and dependant on GitHub this method really is.

Recently, there has been a lot of discussion regarding centralization and the DID spec.

General: current language precludes DIDs/methods leased from an authority

Decentralized Identifier: “Decentralized” in working group name

Prioritizing Individual Sovereignty over Interoperability

Its the position of the developers of GitHub DID, that the method be used mostly for testing and development, and that its risks, tradeoffs and implementation details be made very clear to users, and to put an even finer point on it.

GitHub DID is centralized, github.com is the root of trust, and repo permissions MUST be considered when deciding whether a DID Document should be trusted.
